cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi (200 km) south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-to-north-northeast, on track to cross the Louisiana coast tonight then arc northeastward across Mississippi/Alabama through the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of Morgan City, Louisiana (north-central Gulf Coast)

weather_observation.warning_coast: East of Morgan City, Louisiana to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, Florida, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward through coastal Mississippi, Alabama and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds of 35–45 mph with higher gusts expected in the metro area within the next 6–12 hours
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft possible on Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and along the Mississippi River delta
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated totals to 12 inches could cause flash, urban and small-stream flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible as rainbands move onshore
